title: Geographical Location
description: Located west of Bani Mazar in Minya Governorate, Al-Bahnasa spans a vast area surrounded by fertile agricultural lands.

tips.one: Al-Bahnasa was a great city in the Pharaonic era, known as 'Per Ihnas.'

tips.two: It witnessed various civilizations, from the Pharaonic era to the Islamic period, making it a site rich in historical artifacts.

tips.one: Al-Bahnasa is called 'The Land of Martyrs' because it witnessed the martyrdom of many companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) during the Islamic conquest of Egypt.

tips.two: It is said that over 5,000 companions and followers were martyred in Al-Bahnasa, and it is believed that some of them are buried there.

tips.three: The area contains numerous shrines and tombs of prominent Islamic figures.

description.one: A collection of shrines and tombs attributed to the companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him), such as the tomb of 'Harba bin Al-Harith'.
Dating back to the Islamic era, they are among the most prominent landmarks of Al-Bahnasa.
The site includes remains of Pharaonic temples, statues, and carvings.
Ancient churches and monasteries from the Coptic era can also be found here.

tips.one: The region features a unique blend of Islamic, Coptic, and Pharaonic artifacts, making it a destination for researchers and tourists.

tips.two: Excavations have uncovered numerous ancient relics, such as decorated tombs and pottery pieces.

tips.one: Al-Bahnasa is a significant tourist destination for those interested in Islamic history and ancient artifacts.

tips.two: The site attracts visitors from Egypt and abroad, especially during religious seasons.

tips.one: It can be accessed from Minya city or Bani Mazar via local transportation.

tips.two: Located approximately 200 kilometers south of Cairo, it is convenient for day trips.
